Title: New Fortress Energy charters out Energos Freeze FSRU for Dominican Republic
Description: LNG project developer New Fortress Energy has executed a three-year charter agreement of the 125,000 m3 Energos Freeze floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) with Energia 2000 in the Dominican Republic.
Author: JS

Title: Ukraine eyes Slovak route to meet 4–5 billion m3 gas import need in 2025
Description: Ukraine plans to import 4 to 5 billion m3 of natural gas this year and is betting on the restart of gas flows from Slovakia to meet that need.
Author: JS

Title: British Achiever positions for second LNG transfer at Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG
Description: The British Achiever LNG tanker is positioning itself close to the Gimi floating LNG vessel for a further ship-to-ship transfer of LNG, which could potentially complete the loading of the second export cargo from the BP-led 2.5 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG project offshore Mauritania and Senegal.
Author: CK

Title: China’s April LNG imports stay subdued amid soft demand, US cargoes remain absent
Description: China’s LNG imports in April remained flat against March and lower year-on-year, marking the fourth consecutive month of weaker imports following the recent December high of 7.55 mt.
Author: CK

Title: Port Kembla Energy Terminal timeline shifts as Hoegh Galleon sub-charter extended in Egypt
Description: The extension of the Hoegh Galleon floating storage regasification unit’s sub-charter in Egypt by up to a year, through to the end of 2026, has shifted its arrival at Squadron Energy’s Port Kembla LNG terminal in Australia accordingly,  pushing back the likely commencement of the terminal, which had previously been anticipated by market observers before next winter.
Author: CK

Title: No impact to Barossa first gas timeline from regulator’s rig repair order: Santos
Description: Australian energy firm Santos said it does not expect the timeline for first gas from its Barossa gas project to be affected, despite an order from offshore regulator Nopsema instructing drilling contractor Valaris to halt drilling at the field due to safety concerns with rig equipment.
Author: CK
